alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Mower; Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 04 at 6:11PM CST until January 05 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Significant Wind, Blowing Snow, and Whiteout Impacts Expected Tonight into Wednesday... .A winter storm brings accumulating snow and strong winds to the region starting between 9 pm and 3 am and persisting through Wednesday morning before conditions slowly improve in the afternoon. Winds will gust to 45 mph across much of the area from late tonight through Wednesday morning, with some higher gusts to 50 mph at times west of the Mississippi River. Combined with falling snow, these strong winds will lead to significant reductions in visibility with periodic whiteout conditions, especially in rural, open areas. Wind-prone areas of southeast Minnesota will be especially susceptible to prolonged poor visibility and strong winds where a Blizzard Warning is in effect. Accumulating snow will be highest north of I-94 where 3 to 7 inches is expected, though winds will be a bit lighter over north-central WI. Generally 1 to 3" expected between I-90 and I-94 with an inch or less south of I-90. There will be travel impacts, including the Wednesday morning commute. Plan now and be prepared to adjust travel if conditions warrant it. Isolated power outages will be possible. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected with winds gusting as high as 50 mph and whiteout conditions in blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Dodge, Olmsted, Mower and Fillmore Counties. * WHEN...Conditions steadily deteriorate between 9pm and 3am, with the worst conditions expected from 3 am to 9 am Wednesday morning. Visibilities steadily improve through the day as the snow shifts out of the region. Strong winds look to persist for the bulk of the day. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause isolated power outages. Cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, slow down and use extra caution. Have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
